clues.text: The invaders in this H.G. Wells novel are described as having tentacles & "a peculiar V-shaped mouth"

If it was named for a different character, this 1899 Chekhov play would be "Niece Sonya"
In "A Scandal in Bohemia" & other early stories, Sir Arthur Conan Doyle gave this physician a wife, Mary Morstan
In "A Christmas Carol" the ghost of this dead partner is the first spirit to visit Scrooge
"Les Mis" is probably the most famous musical set partly in the sewers of this city
"The Color Purple" takes place in this "peachy" Southern state, & it premiered there before it came to Broadway
"Practically Perfect" is one of the new songs written for the stage version of this 1964 Julie Andrews movie
A fair-haired law student is the heroine of the musical based on this 2001 Reese Witherspoon film
We loved him as Niles Crane on "Frasier"; now it's "Curtains" for him--he's in the Broadway musical "Curtains"
Study at Ohio's Heidelberg college & you could spend your jr. year abroad at this country's U. of Heidelberg
Go to Georgetown & wear these school colors that signify the union of the North & South afer the Civil War
Don't just study history, but live & breathe it at this college just steps away from Colonial Williamsburg
clues.response: the College of William and Mary

clues.text: Cornell's Dept. of this study would prep you for the "INSECT INVASION" category; it has more than 6 million specimens
You could learn to play the bagpipes & march with the pipe band at this S.C. school whose name means "The Fortress"

rounds.category: HOW TO MAKE A VEGETABLE STEW

clues.text: Cut up this tuber that was native to South America before becoming a major crop in Europe at the end of the 17th c.

Use a bunch of these orange taproots, rich in provitamin A

This story begins, "All children, except one, grow up"
Completes the title of a classic about an African-American family "Roll of Thunder..."

An angry or heated dispute

This is the unselfish concern for or devotion to the welfare of others
In the wild in Mexico, this Christmas plant, Euphorbia pulcherrima, may grow to a height of 15 feet
The ponderosa is one of the most widely distributed American species of this conifer
Horses, cattle, & sheep can be poisoned by eating this weed whose name comes from the Spanish for "crazy"

A variety of this state tree of Mississippi is the cucumber tree, which gets its name from the shape of its fruits

This adjective, from the Latin for "flowing", means "able to speak or write smoothly", as a foreign language
This 10-letter adjective meaning "extraordinarily great in size" comes from the Latin for "to shake"

rounds.text: They're the only 2 Best Actor winners with the same last name; one was a winner for 1979 & 1988, the other for 2005
